header_summary: Antoine Poinsot discusses the need for `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` in a specific context to ensure flexibility in spending transactions. Concerns are raised about the actuary bonding funds for each participant and the security risks associated with generating a single public key. Antoine Riard provides feedback on a proposal for classifying users and designing protocols, highlighting complexities in trust assumptions and scalability dimensions. Sergi Delgado Segura announces the upcoming Bitcoin Research Day, inviting researchers and developers to contribute to discussions on Bitcoin's robustness and security. ZmnSCPxj proposes sidepools as a solution to predicting liquidity allocation on the Lightning Network, emphasizing benefits such as cost reduction and scalability support. Antoine Riard provides feedback on the user classification proposal again, questioning its accuracy and raising concerns about group coordination, channel updates, and fault-tolerance.

recent_posts.title: Actuarial System To Reduce Interactivity In N-of-N (N > 2) Multiparticipant Offchain Mechanisms
recent_posts.summary:
- Loose interactivity and the need for `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` in a specific context are discussed.
- `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` allows transactions to spend either the next state or current state.
- A suggestion is made for participants to generate a single public key, but concerns arise.

recent_posts.title: New BIP to align descriptors, xpub derivation and miniscript
recent_posts.summary:
- Some wallets supporting descriptors maintain vague BIP44 compatibility, but descriptors provide standardized paths for Taproot keyspend.
- BIP44 compatibility is kept in certain wallets for specific output types to remain compatible.
- The issue of reusing public keys within a Miniscript can be addressed by deriving different hardened xpubs or appending unhardened derivation steps.

recent_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
recent_posts.summary:
- The email highlights challenges in classifying users and designing protocols based on trust assumptions.
- Different scaling notions, such as onboarding and transactional scaling, are suggested for measuring off-chain performance.
- Concerns are raised regarding group coordination, routing, fee risk mitigation, and fault-tolerance in off-chain constructions.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Research Day 2023
recent_posts.summary:
- The email announces the Bitcoin Research Day conference on October 27th, 2023.
- The event will bring together researchers and developers to discuss the Bitcoin system.
- It will feature longer format talks and lightning talks for ongoing projects.

recent_posts.title: Sidepools For Improving Payment Reliability At Scale
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender discusses the difficulty of predicting liquidity allocation on the Lightning Network.
- They propose sidepools as a solution to manage funds without closing channels.
- Sidepools help maintain liquidity, preserve privacy, and mitigate scalability issues on the network.

recent_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine suggests that classifying users as "casual" or "dedicated" may not be straightforward.
- He questions the accuracy of a statement regarding the creation of Lightning channels.
- Antoine highlights the difficulty of group coordination and raises concerns about fault-tolerance.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- We are implementing a version of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains.
- The server will be fully 'blinded' and will not learn certain information.
- The protocol involves key generation, signing, and aggregation for secure transactions.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- The storage for blockchain is sufficient due to affordable hardware and optimization efforts.
- Even with a worst-case scenario, a 5TB hard drive can last 21 years before running out of space.
- Ongoing optimization efforts, like Floresta, reduce the space required by individual nodes.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT with revised and improved implementation.
- The code is implemented in the bitcoin-inquisition repo fork, including OP_CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY.
- The proposal introduces OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY opcode with modified parameters for better script writing.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new way to resume lightning channels from a wallet seed.
- It addresses the issue of channel backups and introduces fraud proofs to detect revoked states.
- The proposal also suggests ways to save bandwidth and discusses alternative options without OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard proposes organizing the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- The summit aims to build local Lightning economies and requires a multi-stakeholder approach.
- Antoine invites objections, plans to survey suitable countries, and encourages Lightning developers to participate.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
- Bastien has submitted a pull request to the bLIPs repository, proposing a concept.
- The concept involves using an HSM as a whitelisted lightning peer to send commands securely.
- Bastien offers to provide specifications and review implementation, suggesting open-source grant funding.
